summary: Yttrium, categorized under chemistry as a rare earth element, is a subject of interest in EU legal and regulatory frameworks due to its applications in advanced technologies and materials. As a redirect to the preferred term "rare earth," yttrium is integral to discussions surrounding the regulation of critical raw materials, particularly in the context of the EU's Green Deal and digital transformation initiatives. The EU's regulatory landscape aims to ensure sustainable sourcing and environmental protection while promoting innovation in sectors reliant on rare earth elements. Consequently, yttrium's role is pivotal in achieving strategic autonomy and fostering a circular economy within the EU.
